4. Five-year accident history:
Linde Gas & Equipment - Suffield Warehouse has not had an accident involving release of Hydrogen chloride, Chlorine and Trichlorosilane since beginning of operation in September 2022.

5. Emergency Response Program:
Linde has an emergency response program in place to minimize the effects of accidental release of regulated substances on employees, the public, and the environment. In the event of an emergency accidental release involving our Hydrogen chloride, Chlorine and Trichlorosilane storage systems, it is Linde Inc.'s policy to immediately notify the Suffield Fire Department and Lindes Emergency Response Team Support, either directly by call to team leadership, or via Lindes Emergency Response Hotline. We have communicated this policy with the Suffield Fire Department. All members of the Linde team are properly trained to respond to emergencies at the facility. All employees have access to Linde Emergency Action Plan. Emergency response training, including fire drills, is conducted annually.

6. Planned changes to improve safety:
Linde has a commitment to safety that is expressed in a company-wide goal of Zero/Zero, which means zero accidents and zero injuries or illnesses at each location. We look to constantly improve the safety of our processes using recommendations developed through the prevention program and a program soliciting safety suggestions from our employees.

s of the hazardous substances, the safety systems in place to control these substances, and the critical operating parameters of the associated equipment and systems.
- Procedures and programs to develop, maintain, and control key program elements such as process operations, equipment mechanical integrity, employee training, management of change, hot work permits, incident investigation, and contractor activity.
- Initial and periodic review of new or modified processes through application of comprehensive design safety and management of change programs that include Process Hazard Analysis study and pre-startup review.
Linde has an employee participation program that promotes involvement in the process safety program and helps ensure understanding of facility-specific elements of the safety program.
The prevention program is audited periodically, by our corporate assessment group, to ensure that the process safety concepts and practices are in place and working effectively.
Chemical-specific Prevention Steps
In addition to the required prevention program elements, we have implemented safety features specific to the covered processes at our facility. Following is a description of some of these safety features.
The Linde Gas & Equipment - Suffield Warehouse has extensive personnel and process monitoring to detect gas releases or out-of-control processes. Upon reaching certain thresholds set at or below American Conference of Governmental Industrial Hygienists (ACGIH) levels, alarms will sound throughout the facility prompting a site evacuation if necessary. In addition to the engineering controls mentioned above, administrative controls consisting of personnel attendance is conducted at preset locations within the site. Following a site evacuation, trained first responders from the Linde LEAP program will be deployed to investigate and take appropriate action to mitigate any incident. Executive Summary:

1. The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the facility:
The Linde Gas & Equipment - Suffield Warehouse (LG&E) located in Suffield, Connecticut complies with USEPA's accident prevention rule, and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws. LG&E is committed to operating in a safe and environmentally sound manner and being responsible member of the community by making safety information available to the community. Safety is a top priority at LG&E as reflected in its proactive planning, state-of-the art equipment, employee training and its coordination with external agency to prevent accidental releases from occurring and instituting controls to rapidly mitigate a potential release if it does occur. 

2. A description of the facility and the regulated substances handled:
The Linde Gas & Equipment  Suffield Warehouse is a brand-new compressed gas stocking facility which began operation in September 2022. The facility, occupying approximately 2 acres is situated on 50 Ucar St, Suffield, Connecticut and consists of two secured canopied storage areas, one indoor work area for inspection of valve condition prior to shipment and one office building. This facility stores a chemical listed in part 68 of Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations. Hydrogen Chloride, Chlorine and Trichlorosilane will be stored in quantities exceeding the applicable threshold quantities, as established by the EPA. The processes involving these three chemicals are receiving, unloading/loading, and shipping.

3. The general accidental release prevention program:
In accordance with OSHAs Process Safety Management standard and EPAs Risk Management Program rule, the Linde Gas & Equipment - Suffield Warehouse has a comprehensive accident prevention program in place. This program is built around process safety concepts such as:
